questions.explanation:
Whelan, Michael.

	Michael Whelan also did the painting "The Summer Queen".

questions.text: Which of the Weasley children are the oldest in the 'Harry Potter' series?
questions.explanation:
Weasley, Bill.

	In order from oldest to youngest (I'm not sure who's first- George or Fred, they are twins) the children are Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, Ginny.

questions.text: What color does the code F5DEB3 produce?
questions.explanation:
wheat.

	White is FFFFFF. Whitesmoke is F5F5F5. Wild tangerine may be a color but it was not among the list of color codes.

questions.text: Who is the only Sweathog whose last name fits in this category?
questions.explanation:
Washington.

	Freddie "Boom-Boom" Washington was played by Lawrence-Hilton Jacobs.

questions.text: According to the Abbot and Costello routine: What's on first?
questions.explanation:
False.

	"Who's on first; what's on second." Lou Costello's real name is Louis Francis Cristillo.

questions.text: What is the name of the children's music group with four members with one member named Anthony, who wears blue?
questions.explanation:
Wiggles.

	Greg is the tallest member at 6'4.5" and Jeff is the shortest at 5'10".

questions.text: What was Ronald Reagan's middle name?
questions.explanation:
Wilson.

	Ronald Reagan was thirty when the US entered WWII. He still volunteered for combat duty. He was turned down due to his poor eyesight.

questions.text: What is the Elvish (Quenya) word for butterfly?
questions.explanation:
wilwarin.

	"Wen" means maiden. I made up the other two words.

white.

	In lighting, white is not a color. It is actually all the colors together. Whereas black is the absence of all colors.

questions.text: What city was Kirstie Alley born in?
questions.explanation:
Wichita.

	Kirstie Alley was born to circus parents on January 12, 1955. She is best known for her role as Rebecca Howe on "Cheers".
